shortdesc.ph: The statistics of the remote video stream.

plentry.pd: The ID of the remote user sending the video stream.

dlentry.dd: In scenarios where audio and video are synchronized, you can get the video delay data from networkTransportDelay and jitterBufferDelay in .

plentry.pd: Bitrate (Kbps) received since the last count.
Frame rate (fps) received since the last count.
The decoder output frame rate (fps) of the remote video.
The render output frame rate (fps) of the remote video.
Packet loss rate (%) of the remote video stream after using the anti-packet-loss method.

pd.ph: The type of the remote video stream.

ph.props: ios mac cpp unity rn electron flutter

ul.li: (0): High-quality stream, that is, a high-resolution and high-bitrate video stream.
(1): Low-quality stream, that is, a low-resolution and low-bitrate video stream.

plentry.pd: The total freeze time (ms) of the remote video stream after the remote user joins the channel. In a video session where the frame rate is set to no less than 5 fps, video freeze occurs when the time interval between two adjacent renderable video frames is more than 500 ms.

The total video freeze time as a percentage (%) of the total time when the video is available. The video is considered available when the remote user neither stops sending the audio stream nor disables the audio module after joining the channel.

pd.p: The total freeze time (ms) of the remote video stream after the remote user joins the channel.
The total effective duration of the video is the duration of the call after the remote user or host joins the channel and neither stops sending the video stream nor disables the video module.
The total duration (ms) of the remote video stream.

plentry.pd:
The state of super resolution:
>0: Super resolution is enabled.
=0: Super resolution is not enabled.
The amount of time (ms) that the audio is ahead of the video.If this value is negative, the audio is lagging behind the video.
